answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of places with a centralized communications. You may want to contact them individually for more information.
The following cities have a centralized system.
Rock Hill, SC
http://www.ci.rock-hill.sc.us/dynSubPageSub.aspx?deptID=9999&pLinkID=172&parentID=4
Yuma, AZ
http://www.yumaaz.gov/2257.htm
Chandler, AZ
http://chandleraz.gov/default.aspx?pageid=141
Tampa, FL
http://www.tampagov.net/dept_Public_Affairs/
I found two examples of places where departments had individual PR units or employees.
In Philadelphia the Department of Licenses and Inspections has its own PR unit.
http://www.phila.gov/li/ContentPage.asp?TopNode=resources&level1=70&level2=71&level3=
In Austin the Fire Department has a Public Information and Marketing Manager.
http://www.ci.austin.tx.us/fire/staff.htm
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Toni Shope
text:
Does your organization have a centralized or decentralized communication structure? 
Centralized = coordinated messages from a centralized office such as a department of communications or public affairs
Decentralized = departments/agencies within the organization have their own communications/PR personnel and messaging is not coordinated through a centralized office
Do you think the method you are currently using is effective/efficient? If so, please explain. If not why not?
title: Communication Structure
